Authors:
Danushka Sandaruwan Tennakoon, Rungtiwa Phookamsak,
Chang-ahsin Kuo, Teik Goh, Rajesh JEEWON, Kevin D Hyde
Title:
Morphological and phylogenetic evidence reveal Fissuroma
taiwanense sp. nov. (Aigialaceae, Pleosporales) from Chiayi, Taiwan
Keywords:
Dothideomycetes, Hedychium, new species, phylogeny,
taxonomy
Abstract:
During a fungal collection of saprobic fungi from Shihnong
Forest area in Chiayi, Taiwan (Elevation 350m), we collected a novel
Fissuroma species which is introduced herein as Fissuroma taiwanense sp.
nov. This is the first report of a Fissuroma species from the Hedychium
(Zingiberaceae) host collected from Taiwan. Morphological examination
reveals species to be remarkably different from extant species in having
broad cylindric-clavate asci with long, club-shaped apical and basal
appendages with spread distinct thick mucilaginous sheath around the
ascospores. DNA sequence data analyses based on the LSU, SSU and tef1-Î±
gene regions depict a close relationship to F. maculans, the type
species, but isolates of the new taxon are phylogenetically distinct.
The new species is compared with other Fissuroma species and a
comprehensive description and micrographs are provided.
